p: Models for the current distribution of each species were projected into the future at the standard three different time slices (2020, 2050, and 2080) using predicted future climates from the IPCCâ€™s 4 th assessment [ 40] taken from the International Centre for Tropical Agriculture website (see http://www.ccafs-climate.org/), selecting two HadCM3 scenarios (A2a and B2a). Such Global Circulation Models are widely used in SDMs to explore the effect of climate change on biodiversity [ 5, 41, 42], including likely shifts in distribution, habitat change, gains and losses, turnover and extinction [ 43, 44]. We chose to use the IPCC 4th assessment, rather than the latest 5th assessment and its very different scenarios, for continuity with previous work (e.g. [ 36]) and because the differences in SDMs are slight [ 45].
